alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 4:47PM MST until September 13 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 447 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms in the area of Burro and Boulder creeks had dissipated. Earlier heavy rainfall of 2.0 to 3.5 inches continues to drain into these creeks and area washes. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Yavapai County This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Butte Creek, Francis Creek, Loco Creek, Deep Canyon, Copper Creek, Salt Creek, Bridle Creek, Pine Creek, Little Sycamore Wash, Mineral Creek, Burro Creek, Wilder Creek, Contreras Wash, Boulder Creek, Cottonwood Canyon and Conger Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
